DataElement.preferredDefinition: A negative/positive response using the PI-RADSv2 reference standard of scoring the Peripheral Zone (PZ) or Transition Zone (TZ) for DCE MRI.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Prostate Imaging-Reporting and Data System Dynamic Contrast-enhanced Magnetic Resonance Imaging
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A structured reporting scheme for multiparametric prostate cancer imaging and diagnosis. Prostate images are obtained using multiple MRI techniques including T2 weighted images, a dynamic contrast-enhanced study (DCE), diffusion weighted imaging (DWI), and possibly spectroscopy (MRS). Each lesion receives a score from 1 to 5 for each individual imaging parameter, as well as an overall 1-5 grading score reflecting the likelihood of clinically significant cancer, with 1 being most probably benign and 5 being highly suspicious of malignancy._A modification of contrast-enhanced MRI that allows observation of functional properties in addition to structural properties.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A structured reporting scheme for multiparametric prostate cancer imaging and diagnosis. Prostate images are obtained using multiple MRI techniques including T2 weighted images, a dynamic contrast-enhanced study (DCE), diffusion weighted imaging (DWI), and possibly spectroscopy (MRS). Each lesion receives a score from 1 to 5 for each individual imaging parameter, as well as an overall 1-5 grading score reflecting the likelihood of clinically significant cancer, with 1 being most probably benign and 5 being highly suspicious of malignancy.

Concepts.definition: A structured reporting scheme for multiparametric prostate cancer imaging and diagnosis. Prostate images are obtained using multiple MRI techniques including T2 weighted images, a dynamic contrast-enhanced study (DCE), diffusion weighted imaging (DWI), and possibly spectroscopy (MRS). Each lesion receives a score from 1 to 5 for each individual imaging parameter, as well as an overall 1-5 grading score reflecting the likelihood of clinically significant cancer, with 1 being most probably benign and 5 being highly suspicious of malignancy.
A modification of contrast-enhanced MRI that allows observation of functional properties in addition to structural properties.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Prostatic parenchyma that occupies the posterior and lateral aspects of the prostate gland. The glandular architecture consists of small, round acini amid loosely woven, randomly oriented stroma. The peripheral zone contains large, so-called main glands, whose ducts run posteriorly to open into the urethra. Approximately 70% of the prostate gland lies in the peripheral zone._The zone of the prostatic parenchyma that surrounds the proximal urethra._an ordered reference standard.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Focal, and; earlier than or contemporaneously with enhancement of adjacent normal prostatic tissues, and; corresponds to suspicious finding on T2W and/or DWI

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Focal, and; earlier than or contemporaneously with enhancement of adjacent normal prostatic tissues, and; corresponds to suspicious finding on T2W and/or DWI
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Focal, AND; earlier than or contemporaneously with enhancement of adjacent normal prostatic tissues, AND; corresponds to suspicious finding on T2W and/or DWI

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: No early enhancement, or diffuse enhancement not corresponding to a focal finding on T2 and/or DWI, or focal enhancement corresponding to a lesion demonstrating features of BPH on T2WI

ValueMeaning.preferredName: No early enhancement, or diffuse enhancement not corresponding to a focal finding on T2 and/or DWI, or focal enhancement corresponding to a lesion demonstrating features of BPH on T2WI
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition:
No early enhancement, OR 
diffuse enhancement not corresponding to a focal finding on T2 and/or DWI, OR 
focal enhancement corresponding to a lesion demonstrating features of BPH on T2WI

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Peripheral Zone of the Prostatic Parenchyma Transitional Zone of the Prostatic Parenchyma Scale
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Prostatic parenchyma that occupies the posterior and lateral aspects of the prostate gland. The glandular architecture consists of small, round acini amid loosely woven, randomly oriented stroma. The peripheral zone contains large, so-called main glands, whose ducts run posteriorly to open into the urethra. Approximately 70% of the prostate gland lies in the peripheral zone.:The zone of the prostatic parenchyma that surrounds the proximal urethra.:an ordered reference standard.

Concepts.longName: Peripheral Zone of the Prostatic Parenchyma
Concepts.definition: Prostatic parenchyma that occupies the posterior and lateral aspects of the prostate gland. The glandular architecture consists of small, round acini amid loosely woven, randomly oriented stroma. The peripheral zone contains large, so-called main glands, whose ducts run posteriorly to open into the urethra. Approximately 70% of the prostate gland lies in the peripheral zone.

Concepts.longName: Transitional Zone of the Prostatic Parenchyma
Concepts.definition: The zone of the prostatic parenchyma that surrounds the proximal urethra.
An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.
